Decorator for views that check that the user is logged in and is a carrier, redirects to the main page.

Decorator for views that check that the user is logged in, redirects to the login page if necessary.

Decorator for views that check that the user is logged in and is a shipper, redirects to the main page.

load.models module¶

class load.models.Load(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Model for the loads.

Stores the loads information in the DB fields: shipper, carrier, pickup_date, ref number, origin_city, destination_city, shipper_price, carrier_price, dropped_by.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

carrier¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

carrier_id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

carrier_price¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

destination_city¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

dropped_by¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

get_next_by_pickup_date(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateField: pickup_date>, is_next=True, **kwargs)¶
get_previous_by_pickup_date(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateField: pickup_date>, is_next=False, **kwargs)¶
id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <load.models.LoadManager object>¶

ref¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

shipper¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

If a load is already dropped, it can be rejected.

If a load is already dropped, it cannot be rejected.

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_accept_accepted_load()[source]¶

Test double load acceptance.

A load cannot be accepted twice. If a Carrier tries to do so, a 404 error is returned.

test_accept_load()[source]¶

test_reject_accepted_load()[source]¶

Test the rejection of an accepted load.

An accepted load cannot be rejected. If a Carrier tries to do so, a 404 error is returned.

load.utils module¶

load.utils.calculate_carrier_price(shipper_price)[source]¶

Calculates the carrier price based on the shipper price

The carrier price is the amount of money a carrier will receive if they accept the load. It is the shipper price minus 5%.

Parameters

shipper_price (float) – The price defined by the Shipper.

Returns

The price presented to the Carrier.

Return type

float

Bases: bootstrap_modal_forms.generic.BSModalCreateView

View that handles the creation of a load.

Only a Shipper can create a load.

class load.views.LoadUpdateView(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: bootstrap_modal_forms.generic.BSModalUpdateView

View for load rate update.

Only Shippers are allowed to change the load rate and they can only update their on loads.

load.views.accept_load(request, pk)[source]¶

Accepts an available load.

Only Carriers can accept an available load. When the load is accepted the Carrier that accepted it is added to the load field “carrier”.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – Received request.

  • pk – Load primary key

Returns

Carrier loads list page

Return type

django.http.HttpResponseRedirect

load.views.drop_load(request, pk)[source]¶

Drops an accepted load.

Only Carriers can drop an accepted load. When the load is dropped the Carrier who dropped it is removed to the load field “carrier”. The load becomes available again, except for the Carrier who dropped it.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – Received request.

  • pk – Load primary key

Returns

Carrier loads list page

Return type

django.http.HttpResponseRedirect

load.views.list_carrier_loads(request)[source]¶

Lists the all the available loads (from all Shippers) and the accepted loads of the Carrier.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – Received request.

Returns

The page with the list of loads for the Carrier.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

load.views.list_loads(request)[source]¶

View that list the loads.

The loads lists are different for Shippers and Carriers. These lists are available for logged users only.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – Received request.

Returns

The page with the list of loads for the Shipper or for the Carrier, depending on the User type.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

load.views.list_shipper_loads(request)[source]¶

Lists the available and accepted loads of the Shipper.

Parameters

request (django.http.HttpRequest) – Received request.

Returns

The page with the list of loads for the Shipper.

Return type

django.http.HttpResponse

load.views.reject_load(request, pk)[source]¶

Rejects an available load.

Only Carriers can reject an available load. When the load is rejected the Carrier who rejected it is added to the load field “dropped_by”. The load remains available, except for the Carrier who rejected it.

Parameters

  • request (django.http.HttpRequest) – Received request.

  • pk – Load primary key

Returns

Carrier loads list page

Return type

django.http.HttpResponseRedirect
